intro: Lettsomia strigosa, commonly known as the roughleaf lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil. Lettsomia strigosa is often found in shaded, humid areas such as forests and along stream banks.
